When I ordered my pasta with vodka sauce, he even went out of his way to look up if a non-grain based vodka needed to be used.  For someone with a dietary restriction, it was so nice to have a waiter that went out of his way to help me find a dish that I could eat and truly enjoy!!  Not only was our waiter amazing, but all the food we had was beyond delicious.  I will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas!!

The ambience and service were incredible. The food was very good and we enjoyed it at the restaurant. However, my wife and I both developed food poisoning several hours later. When I contacted the restaurant to inform them they had a number of questions and wanted to investigate. They called back a few days later and said they were sure it wasn't their fault. I explained that this was the only place all week that my wife and I shared food and we were quite sure it was from their restaurant. They responded that I was wrong and would not offer a refund or even an apology.

We came to Sinatra to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary.  From the very second we walked in the door of Sinatra, we were treated like royalty.  The two lovely ladies at the front check in welcomed us warmly and offered to hang my coat.  I opted to keep it as I get a little chilly, and it was tailor made for me and I rarely let it out of my sight. We were also welcomed with a card wishing us a happy anniversary. Beautifully handwritten and personalized.  I knew right then, this was going to be great.

We visited the bar first, as we were a few minutes early.  The bar tender was very busy, yet  very nice and the Pinot Gregio was probably the best I've ever tasted. So smooth and just a brilliant wine.  Hubby had a Bloody Mary and said it was nice.

When we were seated for dinner, our table had a lovely view of the garden patio and fireplace.  Had it been a bit warmer, we may have enjoyed appetizers or dessert out there, but it was in the 40s.  The dining room had such a genuinely warm feel, it was almost as if 'Old Blue Eyes' were in the room.  I believe he was, at least in spirit.

The service at Sinatra is WORLD CLASS. Actually, I will say it is absolutely the best service we've ever had anywhere, ever.  We have been all over the world, dined at Michelin restaurants across the globe. Without question, Sinatra is better than any restaurant we have experienced.

While I cannot remember our server's name, he was impeccable!  We never wanted for anything.  Our glasses were always filled, and he was so knowledgeable about each dish and was great in giving his ideas on each dish. 

We started with a lovely Caesar salad that was just perfect. Not too much, not too little and perfectly plated.  To our great surprise, the chef sent out a most delightful butternut squash bisque with his compliments for our anniversary.  I LOVE butternut squash. and this bisque was just amazing.  Perfection!

Next, our main course arrived. Hubby had 'Filetto' 10 oz beef tenderloin and I had 'Agnolotti' small pasta pockets filled with butternut squash and parmesan. My dish was sheer perfection and brilliantly presented. It was so wonderful and perfectly portioned, cooked to perfection and the taste was too incredible to put into words.  Then, there was my hubby's filet. Oh, my!  There are truly no words to describe this one either. It was by far, the very best tenderloin either of us have ever tasted!  It practically melted in our mouths. SO delicious! There are no words. Cooked to perfection and beautifully plated. Again, just the perfect amount to enjoy.  I could not eat all of my dinner, but hubby would have licked the plate clean if we were at home.  It was just that awesome.  We also shared a side Purea di Patate, mashed potatoes, which were excellent.

We lingered a bit longer enjoying and savoring our memory of an awesome dinner when the staff came and presented us with a personalized dessert for our anniversary!  It featured the famous 'Frank's Hat' and a lovely layer chocolate mousse.  What can I say? That was exceptional!  Tremendously delicious and the perfect ending to a world-class amazing meal.

We waited a while and hoped the check would come, but it never did.  Our server asked if we cared for anything more, and hubby asked for our check.  He walked away and returned and said that this meal was compliments of our adult children!  OMG! I started crying. I could not believe it.  The staff knew all along and kept it secret.

It was the meal of a lifetime, one we will always remember.

Can't begging to tell u how overrated and disappointing this restaurant is. I ordered their signature dish, the 12 ounce veal chop parmigiana - it's huge and the meat Itself is good quality. Before you dig into it, it looks like it'll melt in your mouth. But, as several have commented it's bland and even worse, they have a most bitter tomato sauce. To boot, I ordered a side of spaghetti, cooked perfectly al Dente and then as you taste it, the same bitter almost inedible tomato sauce.  For just about $60 for a veal chop (which I'm thrilled to lay but it does come with expectations of quality and taste) it should've been 1000x better than this. I started with the Caesar salad which has a lemon zest kick and the crunchy lettuce was good and fresh too but again has a bitterness to it.  I never felt like I left a restaurant and needed something sweet to get the bitter horrible taste out of my mouth. What a bummer, I was excited for this restaurant and it's a major disappointment.  Frankly, maggianos little Italy has a sauce that blows this away, surely not the same quality meat, but at least it tastes good.

Over the top Phenomenal! 
Each time I visit Wynn Encore, Sinatra is a must. Whether it is with locals for a drink or a full blown dinner or friends, family or business visiting from out of town, I always point us towards Sinatra. The bar is a memorable event with great drinks and ambiance unless they have some lame college sporting event on the tv that plays no relevance in the sporting world... go back to old Sinatra flicks. The design of the bar from floor to ceiling is interesting and great talking points. The colors and fabrics are all cool! Then there is dinner... that hits it out of the park. It may not be traditional Italian fare, but I love it all the same. The flavors are "close your month and see it" good. Can't wait to go back next week. It never gets old.

Really enjoyed our dinner here.. the prosciutto and melon starter was fantastic. My friend ordered the veal parmigiana and it was absolutely to die for.. the table voted it was the winner of the night. I tried the alaskan halibut, but found it a little bland. My mom's salmon was better. My husband tried to the spaghetti and clams and enjoyed it, but didn't seem to be blown away.

Absolutely incredible dinner! Went for a celebratory meal and it was fantastic. Great decor and the hosts are eager to help make your experience wonderful from the beginning. Reservations are definitely encouraged. Seeing the awards of Ol' Blue Eyes was a great start. Amazing cocktail selection. Had the Chicken Parm and it was to die for. No pasta accompaniment but filling none the less. The trio was to die for dessert!

We had an outstanding meal here! 

I tried: 
Bruschetta (prepared upon request) 
Salad with lump crab meat. 
Beet Salad
Scallop Entree
New York Strip
Polenta Fries with Parmesan
Tiramisu 
Ricotta Lollipops

The Bruschetta is not on the menu. The server, after hearing my husband ask me if it was on the menu (he didn't know what it was called), stated that he would ask the chef to prepare it. It was a delicious treat. 

I cannot remember exactly what it was called but I got the salad with lump crab meat and avocado. It was outstanding. I want to go back just to have it again. Additionally I tried the beet salad. It was perfectly dressed and fantastic. 

I ordered the New York Strip Medium and, while the steak was good, it was a little too charred for my taste. I ordered the polenta fries for my side. Sprinkled with parmesan, they were very tasty. 

Dessert stole the show! We had the Ricotta Lollipops. They were so good. The Ricotta cheese on the inside was sweet and creamy. The crust on the outside was chocolate with little crunchy crispies. These were to die for. Additionally, we had the Tiramisu. I'm not the biggest fan of this dish but it was very good here. The cake was very moist and the coffee flavor was not too overbearing. 

The ambiance in this place is elegant but  cool. It seems like a place that Mr. Sinatra would have hung out in with his friends. We came 5 days before Christmas and got to listen to Christmas carols, Sinatra style, so that was a treat. 

All in all excellent food, great service, cool vibe. I can't wait to return!

I am really at a loss for words with Sinatra. Unbelievable, fantastic, amazing... Etc all of these words could not do justice for this place. From the decor to the service and most importantly the food. At first just the theme of a restaurant dedicated to old blue eyes seemed like a novelty. However the nostalgia just adds to the flavor. Had the beef carpaccio with arugula which was fresh and amazing. The spaghetti and clams was fantastic, and for dessert pana cotta shaped in Franks derby. Definitely worth a try even if you aren't a Sinatra fan

This place was incredible. Enjoyed my 30th birthday here and it did not disappoint. They made me feel like a queen. Extremely pricey but well worth it and the best fine dining I have experienced. The service was fantastic. I will say some of the food could have had more flavor but overall it was great. The dessert with Franks hat was my favorite along with the ambience.

Lovely quiet and well appointed setting make this a great go to spot for relaxed and classy dining. Frank's music, movies, and photos surround the fine dining experience. Service is polished and attentive. A basket filled and refilled with assorted bread takes the edge off one's hunger. Wine list is pricey but nice options by the glass are offered. We split a delicious green salad with a variety of tomatoes and watermelon. Too bad they did not split it for us in the kitchen making our efforts awkward. Lasagna was served with a  spicey meat sauce in a cute little pan. Halibut on a bed of corn had potential if not for the overcooked fish. Gratis dessert of panna cotta was a nice touch along with a card in honor of our anniversary.
Highly enjoyable evening. Sat out by the fireplace on a perfect evening exquisite food\waitstaff. Pretty much as nice as it gets...

One of two "fine" dining restaurants housed in the Encore.  The decor is stereotypical throwback to the 40-50s with heavy brocade wallpaper and iron chandeliers.  It's not particularly impressive compared to those Wynn boasts.  The food also is unmoving although the 3-course prix fixe menu at $56 presents a good value.  The dining experience would have been unmemorable had it not been for their tiramisu.  Chocolate and cake lovers will definitely enjoy this moist, well balanced dessert.

Latest visit to Las Vegas had us staying at the Wynn Resort.  After a day on the casino floor, we thought that we would end the day on a high note with dinner at Sinatra.  We called from the casino floor at 6:00 and was told that we could get right in if we did not wait until later.  Although this was a bit earlier than we would have liked, we hiked over to Encore for a fine meal.  As it turned out, it was OK, but no more satisfying than our gambling luck.

We were surprised to see that Steak Sinatra was no longer on the menu.  Our waiter checked to see if it could still be ordered  and was told that it was now called Filetto.  Since this was a different cut of meat and a peppercorn sauce would make it Steak Au Poivre, I knew my wife was going to end up with a meal that she did not expect.  I went with the lasagna because I was sure I knew what I would end up with.  Although the place was only half full, the order took some time.  That was fine with me.  It gave us time to enjoy the beautiful room, the wine and tasty antipasto.  Finally the entrees arrived.  A plain filet on a plain plate was place in front of my wife, the pepper sauce came in a small plain holder placed on the table.  My wife commented that for  $56 they could have at least placed some sort of garnish on the plate - or given her the 10 oz portion that was listed on the menu.  This looked more like 8 oz.   

The food was OK, but certainly not one of the better meals that we have enjoyed in Las Vegas.   The steak was very tender, but lacked flavor.  The peppercorn sauce did not save it.  The Lasagna was unremarkable.  There are too many exceptional Italian restaurants in Las Vegas to settle for such an average entree.  

Entrees, a side of veggies, a shared antipasto and a shared desert, a glass of wine and 2 martinis came out to $280 including the tip.  The cost was competitive with the other many high end Strip restaurants we have visited over the years, but the meal could not compete with most of them.

What would Frank Sinatra's favorite place to eat look like?

Sinatra is located in the Encore resort, adjacent and connected to the Wynn. Billed as a homage to Frank Sinatra and the only restaurant licensed to use his name, you are greeted at the entry by several of his awards including an Oscar and an Emmy. 

I had made reservations over the phone that afternoon but they had been lost. Luckily it was slow for a Friday night and we were able to be seated right away. The décor is all designed to make the patron comfortable from the word go. The best description I can give is of a late 60s elegant living room. Not posh or fancy or casual, just comfortable elegance. Along one wall are floor to ceiling glass walls with a patio and outdoor fireplace just outside, all to evoke feeling of being in someone's home, perhaps at a dinner party with some celebrity friends dropping by. There are large portraits of Frank throughout, all beautifully lit. Not museum or gallery lighting, more homey than that.

The wine list is a bit pricey but offers a few sub-100 dollar bottles and the one we chose was very enjoyable. The menu is simple but there are 4-5 selections in each category of appetizers, pasta, fish, and meat. We each ordered appetizers including Prosciutto and Melon, Blue Crab Salad, and Butternut Squash Soup. All were good and the portion sizes were good to generous. There were two entrée specials but we decided to stick to the menu. The entrees took a while but we weren't in a hurry so it was fine. To be fair, the waiter had asked if we had any time restrictions such as a show and we said no. 

The Lobster Risotto was a bit bland so we asked for and promptly received some lemon wedges. The pasta with sausage and peppers was simple but good. The gnocchi stuffed with ricotta was also simple but good. The major exception was desert. We ordered a gelato selection that was very good and a Tiramisu that was truly excellent. No matter how many times you've had Tiramisu in other restaurants, this one gives new definition to the word 'smooth'. After your first bite, you'll know what I mean.

The service was attentive but not over the top. You'll never have to ask for your water to be refilled, your waiter will always be easily accessible, and any special dietary requests such as food allergies or special preparations will be quickly and graciously handled. You will not have your refolded napkin waiting for you when you return from the bathroom. Your wine glass won't automatically be refilled every time it reaches the half way mark. 

And there in lies the rub of the restaurant. I suspect that many come here with expectations of grandeur at every turn. This is not and will never be a haven for foodies the world over. You will not get a Michelin 3-Star like impression of the selection or the food. You will not be hovered over by staff anticipating your every move, attending to you like royalty. 

At the end of the day, this restaurant was designed to pay homage to one man. As Steve Wynn says on the first page of the menu, "I think this is the kind of place he would dig".  So what do you envision Sinatra's favorite evening with food and drink to look like? 
For me, Sinatra was a man's man; a guy who enjoyed good food, good drinks and above all, good company. He enjoyed being comfortable with a certain easy elegance. That is the key to this place. Come with a desire to relax and enjoy an evening with a few good friends. Sit down, relax, get comfortable, and let it all happen. It's all designed to be comfortable and let you and your guests get to know each other and enjoy a special 
evening. I'm sure Frank had many an evening like this and I'm sure Steve Wynn is right; Frank would have dug this place.

Outstanding service, really impeccable.  Seating on time, nice table set ups, lighting could be a little lower but good ambiance, veal dish was spot on, and the ricotta dessert was one of the best I have ever tasted.
This was an outstanding choice for us. Great food and great service. They had a wonderful wine menu as well. We asked for a table with a view and they were very accommodating to see that we got it.
Classy, swanky, sexy, relaxed vibe.  As cool as Old Blue Eyes himself - and the food was to die for.

It's difficult to say anything new, but I will add my five-star vote that this was a perfect and delightful dining experience. We started with a Caesar salad, then went on to enjoy the veal parmigiana, veal saltimbocca, and Sinatra clam pasta, with sides of spinach, and crispy polenta. Dessert was the delicious Tiramisu.

It's a beautiful, calm, luxurious room, the waitstaff and service are impeccable. It's a first rate experience in every way!

A very nice and classy restaurant.  The attention to service is superb and the dishes are all classic and well thought of, not to mention delicious.  Consider myself very lucky to have eaten in this very fine restaurant. Will come again!

From very start to finish, Sinatra is five stars.  The place was very lively last night as many conventioneers were waiting to be seated.  The hostesses were all professional and extremely busy.  We were lucky to get a reservation around 9:30, but then really got lucky because we took the two bar seats in the corner facing the outside dining area and the fire place.  The dinner was amazing start to finish. Go.

Sinatra is beautiful, elegant and deserving of the great mans name...but even a stop by fro Chef Theo can't let me give it 5 stars.

Caprese - Where is my balsamic? A few drops do not cut it but the side order was brought upon request...Where is my basil...the art of chiffonade seems lost here, small basil petals really...with almost no flavor...hmmm. Mozarella and freshness of the tomatoes are nevertheless not to be questioned.

Melanese - Oh baby bring it on. While I would have preferred to see the real true "Veal Chop" on the menu, this did not disappoint. Just plain sublime.

Desert - A selection was brought for us and did not disappoint. Outrageous would be a good word.

So in closing not much to knock, everyone enjoyed their meal and the service was impeccable. A little extra work at the beginning, slightly larger menu selection (add a Veal Chop please) and I'll be hard pressed not to give it 5 stars next time around...

Trust me there will be a next time :)

PS. Our table was too big for 5 people and it made conversation a little strained...

Sinatra has a really cool vibe as soon as you arrive. There's a bar that's shows old Sinatra movies and you have Sinatra music playing in the background. My girlfriend is a huge fan of Sinatra so this was heaven for her. The food was amazing. I had the Filetto. It was one of the best steaks I've had. Cooked perfectly with the perfect amount of sauce.

Did not come close to expectations. I had the chicken Parmesan which was bland and boring-same old thing. I agreed to a side of spaghetti which I later discovered cost $11 for a cup of noodles!
My wife did enjoy her fish dish. 
We made the mistake of sitting in front of the cash register that was almost hidden behind the booth we were in next to the door to the restroom. The overall decor didn't tie in to the Sinatra theme-one picture of Frank and music over the PA??
Service was good but we were both disappointed and cannot recommend this restaurant to justify the price.

This is the coolest place I haven't eaten.  I walked in, looked around - thought , "Wow .. this is very, very nice."  and .. "Hey, that's Sinatra's Oscar , right there.   Food looked great.   Very nice menu.   Decor - Shut up , already.   Anyone could feel cool in here.

Loved the food!  My husband and I  came here when we stayed at the Encore. It was delicious! I had the lobster Rissoto and he had the chicken parmigiana. Bread basket was yummy too! Drinks are amazing. Sinatra smash and a grapefruit type margarita (forgot what it was called). Only thing that was disappointing was that we were sat next to an older couple that kept standing up to dance and grabbing each others butts. They were just too close to us. My ambiance was ruined.

We had dinner here on our final night in Vegas. We had steak and fish already so we needed a pasta night. The decor is fun, with tons of Frank Sinatra photos and memorabilia. The service is nothing less than what you expect at the Wynn, impeccable. I had clams and pasta and my husband had the osso buco. My dinner was good, but his was amazing! This is a quite upscale restaurant, so you may want to leave the kids at home, but as a date place, it was awesome!

This place is beyond wonderful. I love Sinatra and what better way to have a romantic dinner than with Frank singing all night over a candlelight meal. We attended on a Saturday night without a reservation. We only had to wait about 30 minutes so we gambled a little while waiting. The hostess was so friendly and called a little earlier than we expected to be seated. 

Once inside we were greeted by our server Pedro who was very friendly. When we asked for suggestions on meals he went into great detail about the most popular items and made everything sound so good. We decided to order Penette and the Lasagna. Both were very delicious and creamy. 

Before our food was served we were given bread with yummy spreads and we ordered a few rounds of drinks. We started with the Sinatra Smash. I'm not a huge lover of whiskey but this drink was actually one of my favorites. While sipping on our drinks we decided to order a few appetizers, the Mussels and another one that had meatballs and cheese bread(I forgot the name of it). Both were pretty good but I liked the mussels better. They were served with a tomato sauce over it that was really good. Once we were finished with our appetizers dinner was served. The portion sizes aren't big so I'm glad that we did order an appetizer to help fill us up :) Halfway through our dinner Pedro served us with a complimentary serving of the chefs soup of the night. I'm not sure if they do that every night but it was a kind gesture and the soup was really creamy and light, it was a tomato basil soup. 

I loved this place and it was so nice to have a romantic dinner for our first night in Vegas. The food was excellent, the service was perfect and the atmosphere was wonderful. I will definitely come back to have another romantic evening. By far one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas!
Absolutely fantastic !!!!! From the environment, the staff and the food, the gnocchi melt on your mouth. As you can see by my plate, I could have ate another dinner.

We came for an anniversary celebration and were greeted warmly and given a table overlooking the garden and the outdoor seating, which was great.  

Service was wonderful from the start, which is awesome because we have had horrible luck with other restaurants in Vegas.  

We both had appetizers, which were good, not great.   The caprese was very different with a variety of tomatoes, but the mozzarella was not as creamy as it could have been.   We then ordered the Osso Bucco and the lamp chops.   Both came out nice and hot and presented beautifully.   The lamp chops were spectacular.   The Osso Bucco was not the best I have ever had as it was a bit fatty.   

We had a wonderful evening and enjoyed the Sinatra music and the atmosphere.

Prices are definitely high.  2 glasses of wine at the bar and then 3 with dinner, appetizers and entrees and our bill was almost $300.  It was a special occasion so we knew what we were getting into, so not a big deal.

This place is absolutely beautiful and so classy. If you're a Sinatra fan you will love the ambiance. No complaints about the service, our waiters were great! The food was great too, not spectacular, but really good! I will definitely come here again. 

P.S. They do an awesome little dessert for birthdays!

Took my date here on Valentines Day.
I had the Carpaccio which had a nice kick to it.  I also ordered the Chicken Parmigiana that came with two huge juicy chicken breasts.
She had the Frank's special Spaghetti & Clams & fungi trifoliate which were good but I'm not too big on mushrooms. The atmosphere is great & I was really digging the giant framed picture of Ol Blue Eyes. I will go back on a birthday or special occasion.
Five stars for ambience, but I've had as good food at chain restaurants...  Might be worth going once with a date, or for coffee and dessert.

one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  The lobster risotto is amazing and well worth the price.  Better than any risotto I've tried at the fancy overpriced NYC restaurants and conveniently located in Encore.  Must try if staying in vegas.  Service is amazing and the decor is perfect as always at the Wynn.

Service is impeccable, food divine. If you haven't been, you must try. Definitely a special occasion for most folks because it's quite expensive, but you get what you pay for here which includes the service, great food and the ambiance, which is incomparable! If you can and the temperature is right, come early enough to be seated on the gorgeous patio. Haven't paired it with Steve Wynn's show stoppers, but I plan to soon!

Sinatra is an excellent restaurant in Steve Wynn's new luxury tower suites hotel at Encore. I have the Yelp community to help steer me towards Sinatra, so thank you Yelp! Quick story; I was in Las Vegas for my mom's 65th birthday and were looking for a restaurant to help celebrate. Originally my aunt made reservations at Switch, another restaurant at Encore. However, I researched Switch on Yelp and saw that it had a 2 star review at the time =X I suggested we try somewhere else and I came across Sinatra on Yelp. The 4 1/2 star review seemed appealing and thus suggested Sinatra. To say the least, I was now nervous because the burden now came onto me. However, at the end of the evening, Sinatra did NOT disappoint, and my mom was very happy with her meal and experience =)

Onto the details.

The ambiance and atmosphere at Sinatra was of class. A modern decor with a hint of old-Italian, combined with high ceilings, chandeliers, a huge portrait of Ol Blue Eyes himself, and a view of the flower garden created a feeling of elegance. Even the chairs were impressive, as if it were a throne itself. However, the beautiful hostess and staff helped each patron to their seats, and hence our night began.

The service at Sinatra is what really blew me away. Our waiter, Michael, was very amiable and down-to-earth. His portly stature, combined with his friendly personality, almost made me call him Uncle Mikey! Although you might expect a bit of pretentiousness at such a classy restaurant, Michael certainly dispelled that notion. He welcomed us to Sinatra and provided us with a quick description about the restaurant, as well as award-winning Chef Theo Schoenegger. As Michael described, Sinatra is obviously an Italian restaurant. However, Chef Theo approached the menu by taking classic Italian dishes and utilized reverse-culinary engineering to deconstruct the ingredients. He then implements his influence to these dishes to create a modern feel to classic Italian selections. That said, he elegantly went over the menu, giving a brief description of the dishes he recommends. After hearing Michael's monologue, I must say, I was excited!

While waiting for our food to arrive, my dad brought a bottle of wine for the table, a 2005 Caymus Special Selection. I believe the corkage fee was around $40? After Michael took our orders, the sommelier (or wine steward) quickly came to our table and asked if we'd like our wine to be placed in a decanter. After saying yes, we observed this wine master at work, delicately pouring the wine from its original bottle into the decanter, then taking the bottle close to a lighted candle, to observe if any sediments were left. After a few minutes of allowing the wine to aerate and breathe within the decanter, she sampled the wine to taste for any tannins. Deemed ready. she brought our wine to the table, and after witnessing all that, it made the wine even more enjoyable! We actually just came from Napa Valley and consumed much wine during that trip (as expected haha), so my dad and I were having a conversation with her. She was very charming and answered many of our wine-related questions, so that was nice.

Okay, onto the food. Sorry for the wait! For appetizers we decided to share amongst the 5 of us. We ordered two orders of each: the Assaggini Di Mare ( a quartet of the sea), the Polpettine (meatballs with polenta and mushrooms), and the Cappesante (seared Maine scallops). I didn't have much of the sea quartet, but I can definitely vouch for the Polpettine and Cappesante! The meatballs were bursting with flavor, as well as the scallops. Together with celery and kumquat fruits, the diverse combination with the scallops produced a refreshing taste to my palate, as the kumquat complimented the scallops well, while the celery acted as the bridge to put the two tastes together.

I ordered the ravioli (with butternut squash, vanilla, and amaretto) for my second choice. I was a bit disappointed in the taste, for it was a bit bland for my palate. Perhaps it was the butternut squash? The vanilla foam on top, however, was a nice touch to the ravioli. My dad recommended the Agnolotti (with ricotta and herbs, parmesan sauce and chives), so maybe next time.

For my main course I ordered the Colorado Rack of Lamb, along with a side of mashed Yukon Gold potato. Yum! The lamb was so tender and flavorful! The meat tasted so delicate, it was literally hanging by a thread off of the meat. The potato puree was an excellent compliment to the lamb, which was suggested by Michael. I'm not sure how Chef Theo did it, but you have to try the meat and see for yourself!

For dessert, I had the bread pudding with gelato. The contrasting flavors and temperatures made the end of my dining experience even more enjoyable!

Overall, I greatly enjoyed my experience at Sinatra and highly recommend! This is no themed restaurant in a casino, this is fine Italian dining at its best!

P.S. Sorry for the long review =X lol

I am a 5 star grinch.   A 5 star miser.  Sinatra's is a DOUBLE five star place.   WOW!!!!!   I found out my buddy was in Vegas while we were.  He knows ALL the best places to go.  I texted him for his 2 best recommendations.   This was one and I was impressed.
WOW, WOW, WOW..... 
Get fancy dressed up, shine your shoes, slick back your hair, clear your schedule.   I think a 2 hour window will work.   The service and attention to detail is over the top.   The food is superb.  I love when the wait staff wants to gush over your table.  We were kings for the night.   Our wife's were queens.   This place was great.
Long live the king.

Great show.  My sons loved it which is a great treat and comfort as a father since they've loved rap so much.   Its good to open their taste to other things.  He sounds and moves like Frank.  Wish he could have done more of his hits but he covered most of them.  Go see it!!!!

Beautiful restaurant.
Initial service fell flat.

We specifically made a reservation for an outdoor table.
We arrive and ditsy hostess says they don't have one.
I was with a high roller regular so he pressed and the manager was dancing around us, afraid to speak the truth, so he said the outside was set up for a private birthday party.

Pressed harder, they finally gave us a table for four.
The outside is lovely but inside is fantastic as well.

Our server Suzanne was spectacular.
We had a ravioli truffle appetizer that was $115 and was decadent.

Suzanne is a professional server and took exceptional care of us.
I don't remember what else was ordered but everyone was thrilled.

When we were finishing, we saw whom the special guest with the birthday was.
They arrived after the entire restaurant was close but since it was an NBA star, they accommodated him.
We had his table.
Too bad lol.

Thumbs down! 

Our server was professional and to the point. 

Food was disappointing other than the Lasagna. The signature dish, Osso Bucco was tasteless, dry and bland. Pork dish was really sad and not even close to what it should be. 

Three members of our party had medium stage food poisoning. (including myself) The common denominator was the $18.00 tomato and Mozzarella salad. 

With so many great restaurants in Vegas you really don't need to hit Sinatra's.

I loved the ambiance of this restaurant.  It's also very cool to see Frank Sinatra's Grammy, Emmy, and Oscar displayed together near the entrance.  

The Osso Bucco was so good.  The meat just falls right off the bone.  The scallops were also excellent.

If you're looking for great food with an intimate setting, this place is perfect.

From entrance to exit my experience was superb!  Best Italian meal ever. 

Appetizer: meatballs & polenta fries = delicious

Entree: Franks' spaghetti & clams= amazing 

Entree: chicken parmigiana = great

Dessert: cheesecake = mouthwatering

Beverage: cappuccino = perfect 

Oh and with your check you get  delicious chocolates and caramel candy.

Great restaurant. You will overpay for sure but some great food, and very good service. Nice dining room as well.  I liked it so much I went two nights in a row and ate the same thing, which I never do. The bone-in veal parmesan is fantastic. It is a pounded veal chop (very thin), lightly breaded and topped with just the right amount of cheese and a light red sauce. The chop literally covers the entire plate and you will be hard pressed to finigh it, but worth the try.
Also tried some pasta and some other appetizers and everything was delicious. Also an extensive wine list with some reasonably priced choices. I recommend the Avongnesi Vino Nobile di Montepulciano.
Very good bread basket as well...save room for the veal!

Management graciously reached out to apologize for my/our experience.  I'll give back a star for this professional courtesy. Expectations for restaurants of Sinatra's caliber/prices are always high.  Again, service makes all the difference in the world - and because of their service I stand by my low rating.  To be fair, the atmosphere and music is very 'Sinatra' which I love,  and for this reason I would go back (w/ smaller party) and try it again....maybe.

Had high expectations for this restaurant and unfortunately was very disappointed.  The restaurant was lovely and the service excellent.  However for the price we expected more. Started with beet salad pretty good. We shared a pasta the sauce was ok but for 38$ it was straight out of a box. For that price it should be house made.  I had the veal chop Parm highly recommend by our server and other reviews It was ordinary , not to mention salty with low quality cheese which i doubt  was house made.  Sadly and disappointed I would not recommend this restaurant.

Ill start by saying THANK YOU to the entire team at Sinatra for creating the best possible dining experience I have ever had.

A couple weeks ago I went to dine at Sinatra to propose to my girlfriend and it was absolutely incredible. A special thanks to Amber for helping me throughout the evening and accommodating my requests. She helped take pictures throughout and caught my proposal perfectly. The server, server assistant, and entire staff provided perfect service. The food was incredible and ambience in the outdoor patio area was better than anything I could have hoped for.

This is an amazing place and I will continue to visit and dine here.

THANK YOU EVERYONE AT SINATRA!!!

Wow.
We had an amazing meal here over the weekend (Sunday evening at 6:00pm), and if I could afford to eat here every weekend, I totally would!  

Jonathan at the desk seated us, plus recommended wine and cocktails to start our dining adventure.  He chatted with us, before leaving us to peruse the menu.  Then our waiter Roberto came over.  What an awesome waiter he was!  He took the time to tell us the specials, and when I asked him what his favorite things on the menu were, he didn't disappoint.

We started with the caprese salad (the man), and beef carpaccio (me).  Wow, wow, wow.  My beef was incredible.  

For entrees we had the 10oz filet (the man), and the agnoletti (me).  Roberto said his favorite was the agnoletti, and that choice was perfect.  Perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned, perfect pairing between the buffalo mozzerella, pasta and sauce.  Gosh.  

Finally for dessert we had the seasonal crostini, and the lollipops.  Both were so good!

Excellent meal, we will definitely be back!

A very upscale italian restaurant riding off the coattails of Frank Sinatra's image, Sinatra at the Encore is a good example of Italian haute cuisine.

The dress code is business casual, with almost all the men wearing jackets and boots and women also dressing up as well. However I went in with a clean pair of tennis shoes, nice jeans, a collared shirt under a sweater and it was fine.

I was with family and we ordered two appetizers to share and  5 different entrees.

Bread is served and you get your choice of individual baguettes, raisin and nut bread, or fennel bread. All three weren't very impressive, fresh, and in fact were dissapointing. The presentation of the butter however was excellent as it was already warmed for spreading.

The appetizers:

We ordered the Tonnato, slivers of tuna fish served raw and with roe and drizzled with oil. It came with a side of sauce that was I believe made from the fish and it was absolutely incredible. It's highly aerated, and looks like creamy but has this nutty, beautifully subtle umami flavor to it. I'm currently on a mission to find out how to make it myself... it'll probably require some machinery to be honest to aerate it that perfectly.

The other appetizer was the polpettine, meatballs and cubes of polenta. The meatballs were soft but didn't have any special flavor to them. They were nice and crumbly without being mealy and were savory. The polenta was excellent though And I liked it's multiple textures. It had a visible crust topside and bottom, a firm, much lighter crust on its sides, but it had a very soft crumbly center that melts in your mouth.

The entrees:

We ordered the rigatoni, risotto, a pasta dish called the chitarra, and I had a dry-aged New York steak.

The rigatoni is made with a tomato-cream sauce with a hint of cheese, fresh basil, and big huge fresh shrimp. This dish was good, and this is a nice fancy restaurant, but it was overpriced to death. 30 bucks for rigatoni pasta that doesn't taste any better than supermarket Barilla is a bit of a dissapointment.

The risotto came with baked Main lobster and it was absolutely delicious. The lobster was succulent and sweet, the risotto was reduced and flavored just right to compliment it.

The chitarra is a spaghetti dish with "hand-rolled spaghetti" that again tastes like it was out of a box. At least it was a perfect al-dente. It's made in a cream-based wild-mushroom saute and seasoned with chives. They screwed up this dish by making it a bit too salty and we had it taken back. When it came back, it came back suspiciously quick (especially when we were told it would be remade), and I tasted it and realized they just dumped more sauce into it to dilute it. Must've been premade.

And finally, to my steak. I had a gorgeous 14oz New York strip cooked medium rare, and it was exactly that, cooked in a broiler, great crust all throughout. The dry-aged beef was delicious, the flavor was exquisite as it let out more as I kept chewing. I especially loved how the fattier edges contrasted with the leaner center. Just great. It came with a side of potatoes and some wild mushrooms, but those were just a speck in the meal. My steak was fantastic.

The service here is nothing short of exemplary for a true fine dining restaurant. I would definitely come here again, but then again this is a town where there are just too many fine-dining restaurants to try to stick to one place. That, and overall I wasn't impressed with some of the food despite the prestige that seems to hype up this restaurant. I was happy with my meal, but for the price you pay here (think 40 bucks a person, average. Safely 50) you expect nothing short of a home run.

After reading several amazing reviews, I chose this for my 30th Birthday dinner with my friends in Vegas. We were extremely disappointed. The service was not up to par with the fabulous Wynn name. I had to ask for things to be removed from the table etc. The ambiance is quite nice but bland.. I expected something a little more nostalgic about Sinatra. After all that's where we were. I must say the bathrooms were fabulous. The food was the biggest disappointment. The carpacio was lacking in flavor and needed salt. The absolute worst entrees are the Osso buccu, that was extremely fatty and had virtually zero sauce to accent it. The risotto was ok. The sea bass was also just as bad,, It all lacked flavor. Please avoid this restaurant, unless your up for bland food, mediocre service and generic entrees. The best part of the meal was when a magician appeared at our table with some amazing tricks, it saved the evening!

I loved this place!  It's cool and elegant, just like the man that it was named after.  Tucked away into a little corner of the Encore, Sinatra is the perfect spot to relax and have a cocktail(s) before heading back out into the Vegas fray.

Just like the man the restaurant is named after, this place is pure class. ;By far the best and most professional service I have ever had at any restaurant. 

Upon arrival I was greeted warmly by the staff and immediately taken to our seat, where both our chairs were pulled out for us, napkins laid in our lap and we were addressed by name. 

Our drinks were never close to being empty and our plates were cleared and table de-crumbed immediately. 

We ordered the following

Appetizer:
Prosciutto (Parma prosciutto, caramelized Bartlett pears,
Parmigiana Reggiano) Best prosciutto I've ever had.. The caramelized pears and cheese were also very delicious. 

Dinner:
Lasagna Bolognese- The bolognese was extremly flavorful and the meat was very tender. Best bolognese I've ever had. 

Chicken Parmigiana- Best chicken parm ever! Huge portions and the chicken was melt in your mouth. The marinara sauce was SO good. 

We didn't have time for dessert, but I'm going to take a wild guess and say that it is also delicious. 

If you are in Vegas, you have to try this place out. Great place for a romantic dinner!

We came here for dinner with 3 other friends.  Some had the prawn cocktail.  I had the caprese which was THE BEST I've had.  Heirloom tomatoes with truly handcrafted fresh mozzarella that was so creamy and smooth.  The home made olive focaccia is to die for.  Two in the party had Clams with Spaghetti in a red sauce which was smothered in wonderfully extremely fresh clams in a wonderful marinara sauce that allowed the clams to speak along with the fresh spaghetti (not the dry stuff),  Another had the Maine Lobster Rissoto that contained a 1.5 pound lobster tail.  I had the Ossobuco that was delish!!!  The last person had the Rib Eye with a red wine reduction sauce that was cooked perfectly and more than 16 ounces.  Everything and I mean everything was done correctly and perfectly in the classic old school fashion.  The portions are generous and not the snobby foo foo serving size and the service is efficient, knowledgable. and extremely pleasant willing to please. .  Frank's name is shown loud and proud.  All of us would come again.  It would really hard to do any better.
Sinatra's is horrible. It tasted like the Lasangna came from  Chef Boyardee. There are much better Italian restaurants on the strip at a similar price point. Avoid Sinatra's.

Sinatra is truly in a class all its own. Nestled in yet another hospitality monstrosity on the Las Vegas Strip (Encore/Wynn), this restaurant is well worth visiting. 

Everything about the experience was first class. From the greeting and seating by the manager, to the sommelier, to the to-die-for food, and our favorite bottle of Domaine Ott Rose (they only had one bottle left...and we shared a bit with our server), we've been dreaming about this place since we left. The polenta sticks were crispy outside and creamy inside, and the meat sauce accompanying them put food I've had in Italy to shame. The second pasta dish we chose was a special that evening of tagliatelle with brown butter and black truffles that were shaved over the dish in front of us. I swear, the poor dog or hog that had to sniff out this truffle would have been dejected had he seen how much we were given.

Again, the strip is over-saturated with chains and mediocrity as we all know, but Sinatra was a complete departure from either. Romantic, classy, and well-executed...that is the Sinatra experience. We'll see you in two weeks!

It was a slow Sunday evening, so I made the walk down from the Mirage, seeking to finally try The Sinatra Smash, a cocktail that originated at Sinatra, but is now offered at a few of the bars in Wynn/Encore.  I went into Sinatra and took a seat at the bar. The bartender Peter is a true master.  The bar was immaculate, but so was his technique. He masterfully measured and perfectly mixed nearly a hundred drinks in front of me, never dropping even a grain of salt from a rim. His workspace and technique were immaculate. 

I enjoyed 3 Smashes, a delicious concoction where the main players are Gentleman Jack and muddled black berries. I can see why this cocktali has won mention from the James Beard Foundation, and numerous references in Food & Wine Magazine.

To start off the meal I had the Prosciutto & Pear appetizer, which was flawless and delicious, nothing new here, but fantastically delicious. For dinner I had the Pennette, a sausage Ragu with a smart smack of fresh and vibrant herbs added for kick.  THIS MIGHT BE THE PASTA I HAVE EVER TASTED.   

I found the service here to be remarkable. This is a great choice for a casual dinner or a serious romantic affair.  Most definitely stop at the bar for a Sinatra Smash before dinner.

My highest reccomendation.

At the Wynn, buisness casual at a minimum to dressy.  Excellent, friendly wait staff, not stuffy, knowledgeable, and appreciative of the diner.

I was so excited to try a new restaurant.  Unfortunately the experience was less than exciting.   Things started off well.  Patrick did s great job opening and decanting a couple bottles of wine.  Wait staff started strong and we had appetizers that were wonderful.   Steak and big eye tuna carpaccio were both great.  Caprese was amazing.   Ordered veal parmigiano was the best ever.  But... yes there is a but... two of us ordered filet mignon.  Rare and medium rare.  They came out medium and well done.  And when we complained, the service went to hell.  Yes they remade our steaks.  No flavor without the peppercorn sauce.   And not tender.  Had two birthdays at our table and the waiter couldn't even say happy birthday.    Even with candles in the deserts.  Pathetic.   Management should be embarrassed.   But nothing short of arrogant.  We started to say something and we were ignored.   Will not be back any time soon.  Price point versus quality and overall service not worth it.   Best part of the experience other than great friends was Patrick taking care of us with the wine.
Lobster risotto known as Astice was delicious and also recommend the cocktail Sinatra is wonderful. Service is superb!

Went here with a party of 9 on a Saturday night.

Environment:  Sinatra has a very nice environment.  Classy photos of Frank hung up, big windows with a clear view into an atrium with lights.  Has an old school classic feel.

Food:  I had a Paloma to drink, which was delish.  The clam appetizer, was decent but didn't taste fresh.  I had the halibut for dinner, so, so dry.  My side by side dinner companions both tasted my dish and confirmed, it was the worst fish they have ever had.  It tasted like cardboard.  I'm not sure if this is the theme for the hotel, because the night before we ate at Andreas and it was also dry.  Horrible horrible food.

Service:  Service was tolerable but not the best.  I did give one additional star for providing separate checks.  Sinatra also added on tip, when Andrea's didn't.  Inconsistent policies.  

Would not go back, nor recommend.

I have to say what a class act...

From the bars classic cocktails to the elegant wine list the restaurant boasts class! 

Started with the beef carpaccio and and glass of some bold red vino and finished with Steve Wynn's favorite the "Ossobuco" served with risotto and complete with bone morrow!

Have a drink and enjoy the history of Oscars and memorabilia.

Cheers!
The veal parmigiana is absolutely incredible.  Service was good, atmosphere was good, and food was great.  You will love it.

Sinatra at Encore has to be one of my favorite Vegas restaurants. Classy and sophisticated with solid eats. We were defiantly the youngest people in the restaurant, but it wasn't hard to see why. It has an elegant atmosphere, and in a city that never sleeps, it is much appreciated. I ordered the New York strip steak with cipollini onions. It was perfection! Cooked just like I asked, and oozing with flavor. Sinatra was the perfect pre-show dining experience.

Frank serenading

lasagna from Italy

a waiter with pride

The ambiance is classy. But what else would expect from a Steve Wynn property. From the moment we entered the restaurant we felt welcomed. Each staff member greeted us with a smile. Our server Dina provided excellent service and was supported by several associates that filled the water glasses and removed the empty dishes. Since we arrived prior to the restaurant opening, our experience started in the bar with some cocktails that were later moved to our table by the hostess.
We had a very comfortable 4 person table next to the life like portrait of Frank Sinatra. 
Dinner began with a nice selection of breads. Our favorite was the date raisin combination accompanied with a basil flower butter spread. 
The choice of appetizer was Panzanella which consisted of jumbo lump blue crab (really big pieces), brioche croutons, tomato and cucumber. Just a fantastic starter.

The entree of Branzino - Mediterranean Sea Bass was served on top of haricot vert, fingerling potatoes, tomato, yellow pepper emulsion salsa verde. This preparation of Branzino was the best I have ever experienced. The flavors were delightful and the fish filet was cooked to perfection.

Our  other entree a 10 oz beef tenderloin filet with cipollini onions and mushrooms in a red wine sauce. The steak was prepared as requested well done. However for a well done steak this one was as tender and juicy as one with pink inside. A superb piece of beef. 

Dessert was Tiramisu served in a bowl with large chocolate slices on top. It was moist and full flavored. 

The finale was 2 complementary Petit Four. A dark and a light chocolate.

Love it all. Service, Food, Atmosphere and Music. Next time we will dine on the outdoor patio. The patio looked inviting with the garden foliage and fireplaces

Very elegant dining.  My wife and I loved the atmosphere.  The pollo was quite delicious accompanied by mushrooms and a rich, sweet marsala sauce. The chicken parmigiana had a little too much cheese, but was tender and tasteful.  Great wine list and amazing caprese salad with imported cheese from Italy which was a great way to start the meal.  Will definitely go back next time we are in Las Vegas.

Just like all things at the Wynn, this is a lovely venue and a great dining experience.  We were celebrating our anniversary and Sinatra's was a great choice for us.

The dining room is beautiful and if it had been a bit warmer, I would have loved to dine out on the patio.  It certainly looked romantic there with the twinkling lights and the fireplace. But, the main dining room is a lovely room and is lit perfectly and the decor is classy.

Our server Dina was warm, hospital, friendly and helpful. She made recommendations, but since I'd already looked over the menu online, I knew what I was having.

We started with a great Antipasto plate and a good Caesar Salad.  The Buffalo Mozzarella was fresh and delicious, as were the peppers and the meat selection.  The Caesar was good, but not awesome.  Though, I did enjoy the anchovy.

For a main course I had the Spaghetti and Clams and my wife had the Branzino.  The spaghetti was tasty and though the clams were tiny they were sweet and tender and there were lots of them.  It was the Branzino that was our favorite though.  It had a light delicate flavor and was prepared just right.

We had not planned on dessert, but since I casually mentioned there was some grit in the clams (a big no-no, but not really a big deal to me, since I liked the authenticity of them and to me the sand showed they were fresh.  As a kid we used to dig clams and a bit of grit was just part of the experience), they comped us the dessert and we had the chocolate Frank's Fedora.  It was very good, but we were full, so it was a bit much.

We are big fans of the Wynn/Encore and have eaten at the Country Club, Lakeside, SW, Botero before it became Jardin along with Allegro and Zooza Crackers and the Buffet. I think our favorite overall is Lakeside, but the new Jardin has sort of bewitched us as a upscale casual dining experience. 

Overall, we'd be happy to return to Sinatra since we enjoyed the whole experience, service, food and atmosphere.

My husband celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary with Sinatra-Encore at Wynn Las Vegas. We wanted to dine with a place that had impeccable service and great food. Sinatra did not disappoint. I had a reservation for 6pm on a Friday night. We were going to be late to the reservation so I gave Sinatra call, Jennifer answered and re-assured me that my table will be waiting for me when I arrive. When we arrived at the restaurant we were greeted, escorted to our table, and given a hand written note to congratulate us on our anniversary.  Suzanne, our server, was great!  We had the Caprese, Frank's Clams Posilipo, and the Pork chops that were a Special for the night. For dessert, Suzanne surprised us with some chocolates and a pistachio custards. I would highly recommend Sinatra to anyone. From the food, to the drinks, to the atmosphere, it was wonderful!

The elegance and beauty of Sinatra's was surpassed only by its fabulous cuisine and Five Diamond service. Although we arrived 30 minutes early, the hostess graciously seated us at a table near the window overlooking the stunning garden. My husband's osso bucco was divine and my tenderloin melted away as easily and quickly as the white truffle mashed potatoes that complemented my entree (Yummy!). Kudos to the entire staff at Sinatra for creating such a memorable dining experience.

From the minute we arrived we were treated as guests. The food was amazing. The service was up there with the best I've encountered. The decor is very appealing.

I highly recommend stopping in if you are in Las Vegas.

Absolutely one of the best restaurants in Vegas, excellent food, location and service
I had Lobster Risotto, meatball appetizer...
Everything was lovely!

A few hits and some misses.  Even Chef Schoenegger's one Michelin star from LA's Patina couldn't save Sinatra.  

As a child of Gen Y, I don't fully appreciate the sounds of Old Blue Eyes.  There are photos of Sinatra on the way in and an autographed photo w/Wynn on the interior of each menu.  And Sinatra's tunes are played continuously through the meal.  

Service was excellent.  Servers and busboys were doting on us hand and foot.  We even got a booth w/o requesting it.  BONUS.  

My main problem was the food.  Some items were eh and others were just too salty for my palate.  

I highly recommend:
Tonnato, $23
Thin slices of veal and seared tuna with tuna foam, really light and the flavors all danced in my mouth.

Good:
Lobster Ravioli, $26
Portioning was generous, about 7-8 FILLED raviolis-loved the sweet tomato halves and the al dente pasta.  

Eh:
Caesar, $19
Damn expensive for something that didn't have the correct measures of cheese, dressing and anchovies.  
Beef Carpaccio, $24
BLAND and super boring.

BAD:
John Dory, $55
Super salty and way too creamy.  Could barely taste the fish.
Bomboloni, $12
This was not fresh and NOT tasty at all.  Had one, b/c I felt bad.
Double Espresso $5.50
Had to get TWO, b/c they were so sissy in size.

Bonus: there was an extra charge for a bottle of wine, we didn't even notice, hey, we were having a good time, server noticed and brought out another receipt for the reconciled amount.  

Probably won't be back in a while, I really enjoy Batali and Bartolotta on the Strip.

"My kind of joint, Sinatra is... My kind of place....". 
Pardon the pseudo-joke, but truly, if you like Italian food, this is your kind of place. If you like Frankie's music, this is your kind of place. And if you like BOTH Italian food AND Sinatra's music, this is a not-to-be-missed stop while in Vegas. 

Our party of three loves both. So we were fascinated with the Sinatra and authentic Rat Pack items on display at the restaurant entrance (intimate correspondance between Frank and Sammy, Frank and Wynn, and others, along with some of his many awards). We were seated promptly and given a window table overlooking the terrasse and outdoor fireplaces. It was a beautiful table, and the whole restaurant is elegant and understated - except for the humongous portrait of The Chairman dominating the main wall! 

Our waiter was superb, catering to my very-particular parents. My father wanted a basic pasta dish not on the menu; he was told sure! No problem, the chef can whip that up. Al dente, perfectly cooked, just as my dad liked it (he is hard to please). The waiter overheard my mother and I saying how we weren't sure we could finish a whole dish and he said he could gladly order us half portions of anything we liked. Wow, that was fantastic! It totally fit the bill! I ordered Sinatra's pasta with clams, and it was light and flavorful and the perfect portion. I forget what my mother had, but she loved it.

I opted for just some coffee after the meal, but my folks had the creme brullee and the various scoops of gelato, the latter which was plated beautifully. They also put a few chocolates on the table, which was a lovely touch. We talked well into the next day about how lovely our dinner was here. Truly, a wonderful meal.

One of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. Whether you sit outdoors or in, the atmosphere is perfect. Sinatra on the walls and in the air, how could you get more Vegas like? The steak is unbelievable, try the herb-crusted filet with a Sinatra Smash!

Great experience and food was delicious...

If anyone in your party is a fan of Frank this a great atmosphere and solid Italian food for Vegas or NY.

 The decor of the restaurant reminds me of a four seasons lobby with life size artwork of Frank and some keepsakes like grammys housed at the front of the restaurant.

The service was nice...I ordered onion soup and the chicken parmigiana and it was the best I've had around town.

My party were all smiles and ready to hit the tables after an amazing meal.

My boyfriend and I came to dinner here with another couple last weekend while we were in Vegas. We wanted to do a fancy dinner at a romantic restaurant. This place definitely captures that mood. However, the food was decent. It's better to make your own entree rather than picking from their menu, which doesn't have that much of a selection. They are pretty accommodating to your taste though. Dessert was probably the best part. The restaurant is kind of loud because it's so small so you can't hear the music playing or anything. The one thing that was a bit annoying was that no table has just one waiter. We were served by 5 different people, which was a pain. Next time we're in Vegas, we'll probably try something else.

This place is 5 stars all the way.  It's located inside the Encore hotel.  The decor of the place is very nice and upscale, with pictures of Frank throughout the restaurant.  My wife and I ate here around 9 on Saturday night without a reservation, and only had to wait about 5 minutes to be seated.  We decided to sit outside since it was such a nice night.  We were seated right next to the fireplace, and they even had heat lamps going as well in case it got a little chilly.  It was a very romantic atmosphere, as the greenery outside was very nice and well kept.  For our meal, we split a caesar salad, which was very good, except for the fact that it comes in whole romaine leaves, so you have to cut it up.  This was only a minor inconvenience, as the salad was very good.  For our meals, I ordered the chicken parm, while my wife ordered the lobster risotto.  We also ordered a side of mashed potatoes.  My chicken parm was excellent, and the mashed potatoes were very good as well.  The lobster risotto my wife ordered was out of this world.  I'm not a big lobster fan, but this risotto was the best I have ever tasted.  Everything was very flavorful and well presented.  They give you a bread basket as well which was good.  We saved room for dessert and ordered the lemon cheesecake.  I'm not a big lemon fan at all, but our waiter advised us that there wasn't a big lemon flavor to it.  He was right, it was excellent and just the right size.  Overall, we will definitely be back here.  It was around $150 for 2 people, but well worth it.  Especially when it ends up getting comped down the line by the casino. :)

What a great restaurant!  Definitely make a reservation here if you are celebrating a special occasion, or even if not!  The restaurant is just so nice, inside and out.  I requested a window table, which they were able to accommodate.  It had a great view of the grounds right outside, which were beautiful.  If I had known that they seat people outdoors, I would have requested a table outside.  However, it was windy that night and the ambiance was nice enough inside anyhow.

Aside from the nice ambiance, the food and drinks were really good.  First came the bread basket and our drinks.  I ordered a non-alcoholic Sinatra Smash, which was fruity and refreshing, just what I like.  I highly recommend it!  For my entree, I had their Pennette, which I really enjoyed and also recommend.  To end my meal I had their chocolate dessert, which comes in the shape of a fedora hat.  I had to get that dessert for that reason alone - very Instagram worthy :p  

Service was good, and overall it was a great dining experience.  Love the Sinatra touches as well, from the memorabilia at the entrance to the Sinatra movies playing at the bar.  Five stars all the way :)

I researched all of the menus and themes in the Wynn/Encore properties, and Sinatra seemed to best fit the bill for what I was looking for to surprise my honey with. Fine Italian Vegan dining? Check! Beautiful ambiance? Check! Soft background mood music? Umm... Yes, if you dig Sinatra music.

Upon being seated by our hostess, I displayed my redneck charm by assisting her while turning the table to seat us. I didn't realize what she was doing as it's customary in these "fine dining" establishments to turn the table a bit to allow the lady to sit down, then turn it back. I thought she knew we wanted to sit on the same side and was turning it to accommodate us. Once she realized that was my thought, she quickly offered to seat us in a booth, side by side. Very nice of her.

The service other than the hostess was a bit substandard. I could see the dollar signs dimming in the eyes of our waitress when we told her we would be declining the drink menu. Yes, I know this was my first trip to Vegas where I stayed near completely sober... When we requested the Vegan menu, she knew our bill wasn't going to reach the point where her take would be $20 or more. From that point on, she offered the minimum amount of service possible while pasting on a phony smile.

The exquisite food all made up for it once it was rolled out. The Chick-non Marsala brought me back to childhood when my mom would fry up some chicken breast in the ol' electric skillet, using her patented blend of Lawry's seasoning. It was one of the most authentically meaty tasting dishes I've had in 16+ years. If that's your thing, this dish is for you! Although it was slightly on the salty side, that's ok for me since I crave sodium as much as my body craves water. This sumptuous chick-non patty was laid on a bed of my favorite pasta, gnocchi. This created a meal, that was nearly worth it's $33 price tag. I can really get used to eating smaller portions when they taste this amazing.

The beet salad was good with various types of beets laid out artfully in a rectangular platter. It was a little pricey at $14 but worth ordering if you're a fan of the beets like we are.

The Cioccolato we ordered for dessert was a cocoa powder covered delight. Definitely order a coffee with this one to soak up all that chocolate flavor. Just don't order a latte. I'm not sure they make them here. They brought out something resembling espresso with steamed milk, yet it wasn't a latte as I'm used to. Maybe go for their cappuccino instead since I think they would do a better job at that. This is a dessert that is meant to be savored, so if you're feeding your partner, take it slowly...

Sinatra is where the true "High Rollers" come to eat http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sinatra-las-vegas#Q_78_I5-KnUrRsAqFrJ1mg You won't have to worry about remembering any of ol' Blue Eyes greatest hits, as they'll play softly in the background, all while you dine in classy, elegant style. It's nice to see how the other half lives, if only for one meal.

If you have a special someone in your life that loves Italian food, but just so happens to be Vegan, take them to Sinatra. You may just make their day as special as they are themselves.

Immaculate. Outstanding. Perfection. These are the words to describe my Sinatra experience.  As I was eating I was thinking "this is the best Italian food I've had in Vegas." Towards the end i realized it was actually on the list of best anywhere. First and foremost I have to compliment Roger, our waiter. This guy was present, engaged and overall a complete professional. He was great with recommendations and pacing out the meal. They take care of their guests here and I just felt good with the whole transaction, even though it is pricey, there is serious value. For example, the bread they bring, if you told me it was baked in a Brooklyn bakery that morning, it would be completely believable. Or another example the silverware was actual silver. The glass they pour your water in sat well in your hand. The little things, the details, were all there.  I started with the vegan Caesar salad, with lemon and capers instead of anchovies. It was amazing, clearly every rib of romaine was hand selected for crispness and quality. The Meatballs with Polenta Fries app was mouth watering and delicious. Amazing and worth the trip just for that app. Had a strong Chicken Marsala over gnocchi for entree and desert was the soothing Panna Cotta. Bam. The vibe of the restaurant is early 60's mod with warm pastels and floor to ceiling photos of Ole Blue Eyes. Really interesting decor, they have one of Frank's Academy Awards next to the hostess station, along with a Grammy and an Emmy. If they can get a Tony it will be an EGOT. So yeah... I had an amazing experience at this spot. Go there.

Nice restaurant with better than mediocre food but not amazing. My dad had the veal parmigiana which I thought was bland and tasted like it had been breaded with shake n'bake breadcrumbs. It was huge but lacked flavor. My food was very good and the best part of the meal. I had the mozzarella and tomato salad which was made with burrata and I thought it was very good. The Frank's clams were very good as well and coated in a flavorful tomato sauce. My husbands steak was overcooked and didn't taste at all like filet mignon. It's a decent place but there are a whole lot of better options in Vegas.

I wanted to like Sinatra, especially after reading all of the great reviews. However, I was not impressed by the way our waiter seemed to lose all interest in our table after we said we weren't getting drinks. After that, he made a big show of visiting every other table, talking to them, being social -- he refused to even look at us. In fact, we never saw him again. We had to flag down another waiter to ask for the check!
The food was not worth the price. To be honest, it was a bit cold (we were the last table by far to receive our food), and it all just tasted like it came out of a can or something. The whole atmosphere felt like a catered conference dinner. It was that impersonal.
If Sinatra were somewhere else, I would shrug this off as just a bad night for them, and I might give it another chance. BUT, this is Vegas, and there are about a billion other places to go that offer reliable perfection.

I cannot say enough good things about this place, and the Wynn in general. We stayed in the Wynn Tower Suites, and before heading XS were give this place as a recommendation by our concierge. Holy smokes was it delicious. 

Truthfully, this is probably one of the best meals I've had in my life. Anywhere. Hearty portions, outstanding service, ridiculous wine list, and ambiance to die for. 

Cannot wait until my next trip to Vegas. This will be my first dinner spot!

not cheap but you can pay more for less. Somewhere for a special night out rather than a scarf before the craps

Service excellent
Food, OK, no complaints
wine good

everywhere else had a long wait; this didn't and was very good. maybe because it is hidden in the relatively quiet Encore

I have to say, it was because of Sinatra that inspired me to create an account on Yelp and share my passion for this place with the internet world. 

First of all, my bias must be clear: I am a huge fan of Frank Sinatra. When I saw Encore had a place dedicated to the Chairman of the Board, I immediately thought, "I must eat there!"

The atmosphere didn't disappoint in the slightest. The first thing you see upon walking in is Frank's actual Oscar, Emmy, and Grammy awards (very cool!) as well as some of Steve Wynn's personal memorabilia harkening to the memories he shared with Frank. They have jazz standards on the sound system and old Sinatra movies on a TV over the bar. While I was there, Guys and Dolls was playing and then it switched over to From Here to Eternity. The restaurant is further complimented with giant, wall-sized pictures of Sinatra. So far, the place was definitely living up to my expectations.

What I didn't expect, however, was how good the food would be...

Appetizer: Carpaccio tuna. Light, delicious, almost melted in your mouth. Even if you're not a big fan of sushi, you will enjoy this dish. 

Main Course: Chicken Saltimbocca. This was a whole breast of chicken on the bone, with prosciutto baked around it, served on a bed of spinach.  The chicken was juicy and the prosciutto was fantastic. As a side dish I had the gnocchi, which was actually kind of a let down. It was too overdone and as a result was way too soft and mushy. 

Dessert: Tiramisu. Probably one of the best exampled of tiramisu I have ever had. Light, airy, and yet filling. 

All in all, I had a great time at Sinatra. By the way, the cocktails are superb, so even if you just stop by for a drink you will enjoy yourself. I recommend the Negroni.

We had such a wonderful dinner last week at Sinatra. We were in LV celebrating a birthday and chose Sage in the Aria for the birthday dinner and were so disappointed we went to Sinatra's the next night to make up for it and they certainly did.

We were staying at the Encore and when making the reservation mentioned my friends birthday. As soon as we arrived and seated they handed him a birthday card.  Our waiter was so charming. We ordered the antipasto plate and the meatballs for appetizers which immediately erased the meal the night before.

For dinner, I had the chicken parmesan and he had the special tortellini with artichoke. They were like soft pillows. The chicken was amazing and stood alone.

For dessert we had the ricotta cheesecake which was light and airy.

This was a dinner where the service, ambiance and food equaled each other in every way.

Sinatra is always great with their food and service. If you have time to wait. sit in the outside patio. You will love it. Mr. Wynn goes above and beyond that he has the highest quality of both food and ingredients in throughout his resorts. 

I had the scallops for dinner, they were ok. They need to improve on the scallops.
My wife had the ciopinno, and I had it during a previous visit. That dish is a must have... it is to die for.

All of the staff were on the highest standards of service.

I will always go to Sinatra when I go to Vegas. I only stay at the Wynn Resort because it is the finest in the region.

Mr. Wynn doesn't play games... He is the Walt Disney of adult Disney...VEGAS! He wants nothing but the best for his visitors.
We had a great experience here. The food was great and the service was very polite, not snooty and just perfectly appropriate.  Would highly recommend for a great meal and good Rat Pack atmosphere.

"The Perfect Romantic Restaurant!"

This restaurant located at the Wynn Hotel is definitely representative of Frank Sinatra himself. The food is definitely Italian and the best I've had in a long time. The ambiance provides for a very romantic evening with someone you love. Both my husband and I enjoyed our evening immensely. We'll definitely return. If you want to try something fun, try the Sinatra Smash at this restaurant. Other establishments in the Wynn Hotel say they can replicate it, believe me when I say they can't. 


Visited July 2013

Wonderful! Our new favorite! We had a 5:30 reservation and were seated promptly. We asked to be near the window facing outside looking at the fireplace. Beautiful view. Extremely wonderful service from the moment we stepped in to the moment we had to run out so we wouldn't be late for our show. 

The drinks were delicious. My lemon drop was made exactly how I like it...on the sweeter side... And the house wine was wonderful (pinot). 

We were given an assortment of bread that included sourdough, raisin, baked Parmesan and real bread "sticks". Also, we were given two spreadable mini cups of deliciousness. One was salted (delicious) butter and the other was a purée of yumminess...I can't remember, but I'm picky and it was fabulous. 

The Caesar is a real Caesar salad. Anchovies and full cuts of lettuce perfectly dressed with delicious large croutons. I was in Caesar salad heaven. 

My mom and I each got the lobster tail over el dente risotto with mushrooms and asparagus. Do I even need to go on...every ounce of the main course was amazing. I savored every bite. 

Next time, we would like to order an espresso with a dessert...we just did not have the time :(

We realized we were cutting it extremely close to our 7pm showtime and unfortunately had to run like bandits. The server was quick to bring us our bill and a plate of goodies I wanted to dump in my purse...but that's not classy. ;) 

We knew where we were dining and decided not to worry about the prices. It was expensive, yes, but worth every single penny. 

If I could give it 10 stars, I would.

OK
We have now been TWICE
Once we went with my cousins and we had a table of four smack dab in the middle of the restaurant....(not a good choice), then my wife and I asked for a quiet romantic table PERFECT spot.
   I ordered the same dish as last time, VEAL PARM with the BONE!
Frickin' gorgeous! 
It is the best VEAL PARM I have ever had and I'm 53! (Thats a lot of veal parms to compare it to)
I had to stop eating when I got so full.
It is a la carte meaning no side of pasta (weird huh?)
So I asked for a side of pasta(it came out in a tint 8 oz copper cup for $12 !!!) OUCH!!
yes, the veal parm was $52, but WORTH every $$
The cappuccino was one of the best I have ever had too! (And I have been all over ITALY several times)
Then the dessert which was FRANK's Chocolate Fedora was the final ending to a perfect meal.
EXCELLENT service too! (we went on a saturday night @ 6pm)

I highly recommend this place....

My husband Russ and i had gotten married in Vegas on December 19th, 2014, and chose to go to Sinatras for our wedding dinner. It was amazing! 
To be honest, we stuck out a little, considering we aren't well off like many others that were dining there that evening. We were among wealthy businessmen and their wives.
None the less, we weren't there for that.  
We were celebrating the beginning of our lives together. We had a beautiful ceramony earlier that day, and we were ready to splurge. 
I ordered my favorite wine, a crisp pino griegio, and my handsome husband ordered a beer. (Definitely more his style). 
I ordered lobster ravioli(my favorite) and my husband  ordered paglioteli pasta with a cream sauce. Both were so yummy. The service was absolutely amazing. 
At the end of our meal, our waitor brought us chocolates and caramels with "congratulations"  written on the plate out of chocolate syrup. We were so touched. The attention to detail and impecable presentation was so memorable. Thank you to Sinatras for making our evening so special!!

Yet another excellent Wynn restaurant. One of the amazing things about this place is that upon entering you forget that you are in Sin City. It is classy, upscale, romantic and peaceful. They play Sinatra music (of course) inside and on the patio. The restaurant is very old school and cozy; even the outside is cozy with fireplaces (although they were off when we dined there since it was a warm evening). 

Our waiter was his team excellent; very nice and very attentive. He was also incredibly accommodating; I couldn't decide between the halibut because I loved the presentation with gnocchi and mushrooms, or the scallops because I prefer scallops to halibut , so he let me do the scallops with the halibut presentation! 

I highly recommend dining outside; it is a beautifully landscaped, intimate setting. 

Get the crab panzanella app and scallop entree!

My husband and I came by for Frank's 100th birthday. Great vibe as usual. Love the decor and the ambiance. His music playing over the speakers and the orange table cloths. My husband got upset because we had an issue with drinks and being carded by the waiter after the fact. But the general manger was awesome and literally fixed everything to make it right.
